channel.title: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!
channel.description: I don't know where and how to change the IP address for the client. I'm new to this and would like help. THANK YOU!!!

item.source: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!

item.title: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Make sure the IP you put is identical to the one your server is listening on. If you’re running the server, make sure the IP your client is connecting to is either your No-IP address, or “127.0.0.1”.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!

item.title: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!
item.dc:creator: @Rrie Rrie
item.description:
@Rrie wrote:

Now it gets stuck at connecting to JCScape 525 Server…

What am I supposed to add? Am I doing something wrong?!?!

EDIT: Am I supposed to do this for client files or server files?

I am wanting to run my server over the internet. I’ve already gotten my no-ip.

Now i’m getting “error_invalidhost” in the cmd.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!

item.title: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Go into client.java and search for the current IP address (if you don’t know it, try “127.0.0.1”). After you’ve found it, just replace it with what you like

Read full topic
item.source: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!

item.title: Can't change ip to my own?!?! WTF DOESN'T RUN!
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Did you look? Dont say yes, in every file, because you will fail right there.

The files it can be in are as follows:
client.java
EGUI.java
Gui.java
